page.title: 02SPONDON DIVIDED BY BYPASS
page.content: The bypass dual-carriageway divides the local community and many on the school side feel socially isolated and under facilitated.A survey was carried out recently,sampling responses from one hundred people in the school area to assess the need for community provision,possibly based on the school.The following results were obtained.{INTERVIEWED}-60 Females and 40 Males.{STATUS}-69 Married,18 Widowed,9 Single,4 Divorced and 0 separated.{AGE}- 4(16-18),9(18-25) 24(25-35),17(35-45),16(45-55), 12(55-65)And 18(65+){UNEMPLOYED}in household- 78 no and 22 yes.{SUBJECTS} which the interviewees might be interested in following were wide ranging but featured 62 requesting meetings fulfilling social needs,46 for keep fit sessions and 59 for educational classes.
